title: What happens if a strep throat goes untreated? - Quora

response.answer_text: If it's truly Streptococcus pyogenes then your body will slowly fight and destroy the pathogen. But it is a slow process, at first. Subsequent infections of S. pyogenes will be shortened. Strep throat is self-limiting, antibiotics helps speed up the process.

It could lead to rheumatic fever, bronchitis or pneumonia. Rheumatic fever can affect the heart and lead to other problems. Never ignore or not treat a strep throat. While it may go away on its own, it’s not worth the risk. It’s just a simple 7–10 day course of antibiotics.
